sections.markdown:
# Tips
* Use the drop downs for starter DQL 
* ![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/starterdql.jpg?raw=true)
* For simple filters, you can use the Explore Logs feature. This also allows you to create a DQL from the simple explorer. 
* ![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/explorelogs.jpg?raw=true)
* Click on fields in table view for easy filter, sort and summary commands
* ![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/clickonfield.jpg?raw=true)
* Tips & docs as you query
* ![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/typedoc.jpg?raw=true)

# References
* Learn DQL App (Good place to start for beginners): https://<DT_TENANT_ID>.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/apps/dynatrace.learndql/
* DQL Course on Dynatrace University: (More in-depth content): https://university.dynatrace.com/ondemand/course/39387?content=overview
* Documentation: https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/shortlink/dql-dynatrace-query-language-hub
* Dynatrace Pattern Language: https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dpl-dynatrace-pattern-language-hub
* Keep honing your skills with the Playground environment https://wkf10640.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/ or in your company's DT tenant. 
* Download the notebooks and dashboards as a reference. These demo environments will only be alive for 90 minutes after our training ends.
